text:
Barton Lee Hazlewood (July 9, 1929 – August 4, 2007) was an American country singer, songwriter and record producer. He was most famous for writing the song "These Boots Are Made For Walking" for Nancy Sinatra. He was born in Mannford, Oklahoma.
Hazlewood died of kidney cancer on August 4, 2007 in Henderson, Nevada at the age of 78.

annotations.surface_form: These Boots Are Made For Walking
